TopicTitle: The Physics Of Methane Fire Spewing Tails... Safe for the User Or Not?

Articles.Content:
There is nothing in physics that prevents the following but I wonder if it would even be safe at all.

Scenario: A humanoid with a tail that has a claw at the end that can open and spew methane gas the body stores in special organs near the base of the tail.

 

Methane is spewed back with enough force that if ignited a flame would reach 10 feet.

When open the claw can arc an electric bolt between it's prongs, which is just enough to ignite the methane blown out from the claw because of oxygen in the air.

 

Questions: How should the tail be designed for a reasonable amount of saftey for the user?

 

I assume a short tail is better than a long one, simply because it takes less distance/time to spew methane in emergencies.

I also assume a user would primarily want to blast behind them, since trying to blast stuff sideways would flick off the tail's aim from the thrust created by shooting the methane gas ten feet.

One could do a sideways blast but the force woud immediately flick the tail in the opposite direction, so pulse blasts is the best one could do sideways.

Kind of like a high pressure hose.

 

Obviously a user does not want to set fire to themselves... I trust this design is reasonably safe?

 

I presume a long tail is worse from a safety POV for the user.

 

Thoughts?

Should be safe enough provided that no outside air is drawn back into the methane storage organ. In use, the flame can’t back-propagate into an oxidiser free environment since it will just go out.

No idea what methane pressure is required to generate a 10 foot flame but tails can be pretty muscular. Or, for that matter, the tail could be more like a trunk and they’re plenty muscular.

I don’t think that aiming the flame is going to be a problem. Storing enough methane for a sustained flame might be though - I imagine your critters will be ‘pulse blasting’ due to lack of fuel more than anything else.

Since virtually all methane the body produces is siphoned off for the methane storage organs.

3 hours ago, Spacescifi said:

Second but kind of gross question... how will their poop smell if it lacks methane?

The same as normal crap. Methane, butane, propane and so on has no smell - the gas that's used in a bunsen burner has had stenchants added that make it detectable in the event of a leak. The smell of crap is a mixture of skatole, indole, and sometimes putrescine and cadaverine. If created by a gut, you get those odors deposited in the solids, though as a volatile solid those chemicals might be excreted through your creature's tail-thrower gas anyway.
